description:
This month we'll be presenting an evening of lightning talks. If you have been to previous Lightning Talk evenings, or the ACCU Conference, you'll be familiar with the format: a series of short talks from various members of the group. 

Each talk will be ten minutes or less. Come along and enjoy a varied, fascinating evening! We have talks on test frameworks, motivation, hyper-threading and more. Our lightning talkers are:

• Grant Armstrong - How unit testing changed my code

• David Banks - What is a quality test suite?

• Jon Chesterfield - DIY test framework

• Perry Gollo - Motivation

• Dave Needham - Moving below the database with Event Sourcing

• Ed Nutting - FlingOS: Teaching students on their level

• Dominic Robinson - A little bit of Pluscal

• Steven Simpson - Mixing compiled and interpreted languages: Why and how with examples using Python and C++

• Dan Towner - Hyper-threading: making 2 plus 2 equal 3
title: Lightning Talks
